subject: Hockey, Ice
Stanley Cup
lead_paragraph: The Detroit Red Wings took care of their muddled goaltending situation yesterday by signing the 14-year veteran Dominik Hasek to a one-year contract. The 41-year-old Hasek, who helped the Wings gain their last Stanley Cup title, in 2002, is returning to Detroit after an injury-plagued season with the Ottawa Senators. He joins another Red Wings Cup-winning goalie, Chris Osgood, who was brought back as a reserve.
